1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: {\an8}なんで今日はニヤニヤしてるの？
1.english: why are you so smirky today?

4.speaker: PENGUIN
4.japanese: 実はね 今度個展を開くことになったんだ
4.english: Well, you see... I'm going to be opening my own exhibit.

7.speaker: PENGUIN
7.english: That would be a traditional short coat (hanten).

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: 個展だよ こーてーん！
9.english: I said an exhibit. An ex-hib-it!

10.speaker: SASAKO
10.japanese: へぇ～ すごいですね

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: 個展って なにするの？
11.english: What do you do at an exhibit? You'll just have to come and see.

12.speaker: PANDA
12.english: Where is it at? It should be right around here.

15.speaker: POLAR BEAR
15.japanese: ペンギン その新時代 新世界
15.english: Penguin: The New Age, New World.

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.japanese: ハードル上げすぎだね
16.english: I think he set the bar too high.

18.speaker: POLAR BEAR
18.japanese: たぶん 中に入ってみればわかるよ
18.english: I think you'll understand once we go inside. Hello!

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: やぁやぁ いらっしゃい

23.speaker: POLAR BEAR
23.japanese: ペンギンさんって 形から入るタイプだよね
23.english: Mr. Penguin, you certainly like to look the part.

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.japanese: ほら 僕の絵見てってば！

26.speaker: PENGUIN
26.japanese: まずは この絵を見てよ

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.japanese: これはね 強い日ざしを浴びながら
27.english: With this, I was trying to express a flower's life force as it soaks in the sun's rays and blossoms.

28.speaker: PENGUIN
28.english: It's titled... "Dandelions"! I'm pretty sure I've seen this before...

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

31.speaker: PANDA
31.japanese: ペンギンさんって すっごいなで肩だね
31.english: You have such sloping shoulders, Mr. Penguin.

33.speaker: PANDA
33.japanese: カバンはどこにかけるの？
33.english: How do you carry a bag?

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.japanese: パンダくん！ 絵を見てってば！
34.english: Would you look at the paintings, Panda?

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: 次は この絵を見てよ
35.english: Next, take a look at this piece.

36.speaker: PENGUIN
36.japanese: {\fs23}これは実際に見たものと絵に定着したものとの相関とかい離を楽しんでほしいな
36.english: In this piece, I'd like people to appreciate the familiar yet dissociative feeling of real-life objects set in a painting.

37.speaker: PENGUIN
37.japanese: タイトルは「ピレネーの白卵」
37.english: It's titled... "The White Egg of the Pyrenees."

38.speaker: POLAR BEAR
38.english: I'm pretty sure I've seen this before...

39.speaker: PANDA
39.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん
39.english: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin. What is it?

40.speaker: PANDA
40.japanese: ペンギンさんの目はどこにあるの？
40.english: Where exactly are your eyes, Mr. Penguin?

42.speaker: PENGUIN
42.japanese: いいからこっちを見てよ～！
42.english: Would you just look over here? What a pretty wall!

43.speaker: PENGUIN
43.japanese: だから 絵を見てってば！
43.english: I'm asking you to look at the painting!

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.japanese: じゃあ 次は この絵ね
44.english: So this is the next piece.

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.japanese: これは 現代社会に生きる人間の不安感
45.english: This is a piece that expresses in detail the uneasiness

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: 病理に 鋭く切り込んだ作品なんだ
46.english: and pathology of the people living in modern society.

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.japanese: なんで わかったの？

50.speaker: PANDA
50.japanese: いや なんとなくね

51.speaker: POLAR BEAR
51.english: What's this? These are paintings of seas.

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.english: This one is the Baltic Sea.

53.speaker: PENGUIN
53.japanese: これは ベーリング海

54.speaker: PENGUIN
54.japanese: これは 北極海でね
54.english: And this one is the Arctic Sea.

55.speaker: PENGUIN
55.japanese: ほら このベーリング海なんかはね
55.english: You see, I had a hard time successfully expressing

56.speaker: PENGUIN
56.japanese: 水温の感じを表現するのに苦労したんだよ
56.english: the water temperature in the Bering Sea painting.

57.speaker: PANDA
57.english: Wow, that's amazing. So, where are the paintings?

59.speaker: POLAR BEAR
59.japanese: これはペンギンさんの青の時代かな
59.english: I'm guessing this is from your blue period, Mr. Penguin.

60.speaker: PENGUIN
60.japanese: ぼんやりしたフォロー ありがとう シロクマくん
60.english: Thanks for the vague follow through, Polar Bear. So, how was it? Let me know what you think.

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.japanese: う～ん ちょっと オリジナリティーが足りないかな
61.english: Hmm... I think it lacked originality.

65.speaker: PANDA
65.japanese: ペンギンさん 早く絵を見せてよ～！
65.english: Hurry and show me your paintings, Mr. Penguin!

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.japanese: キミは… ちょっと黙っててもいいよ？
66.english: You know, it's perfectly fine if you don't say anything.

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.japanese: ほら お客さんだよ

68.speaker: PENGUIN
68.japanese: きっとキミたちとは違う 芸術のわかる人だよ
68.english: I'm sure he's someone that understands art, unlike you two! Pardon the intrusion.

70.speaker: PANDA
70.japanese: ペンギンさん これすごくいいよ？
70.english: Mr. Penguin, I really like this.

72.speaker: PANDA
72.japanese: 寝心地いいね このじゅうたん
72.english: This carpet is really comfortable to sleep on.

73.speaker: PENGUIN
73.japanese: そっち！？ っていうか勝手に寝ないで！
73.english: That's what you're talking about?! Or rather, would you not sleep there!

74.speaker: PANDA
74.japanese: ペンギンさんも 一緒に寝る？
74.english: Would you like to sleep, too, Mr. Penguin?

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.japanese: {\fs23}パンダくん キミ食べて寝る以外の趣味を持ったほうがいいんじゃない？
76.english: I think it'd be best for you to find some hobbies other than sleeping and eating, Panda.

78.speaker: PENGUIN
78.english: Like what? I like to lay around.

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.japanese: それは趣味とは違うでしょ？
79.english: I don't think that counts as a hobby.

80.speaker: PENGUIN
80.japanese: シロクマくんは趣味多そうだよね
80.english: You seem to have a lot of hobbies, Polar Bear.

81.speaker: POLAR BEAR
81.japanese: サーフィンやスキューバ
81.english: Well, there's surfing and scuba diving.

82.speaker: POLAR BEAR
82.japanese: 冬はスノーボードとスキー
82.english: In the winter, I like to snowboard and ski.

83.speaker: POLAR BEAR
83.japanese: あとは登山なんかもするよ

84.speaker: PANDA
84.japanese: へぇ 僕もそれにするよ
84.english: Wow. I think I'll do that, too.

85.speaker: PENGUIN
85.japanese: パンダくんがやってる姿がイメージできるのは何一つないね
85.english: I don't think I can picture you doing any of those, Panda.

86.speaker: POLAR BEAR
86.japanese: グリズリーくんは バイクに乗るのが趣味だね

87.speaker: POLAR BEAR
87.japanese: よく休日にはツーリングに行ってるよ
87.english: He loves to go touring on his days off. That's right. He has pictures around his bar.

88.speaker: PANDA
88.japanese: かっこいいなぁ 僕もそれにするよ！
88.english: How cool! I'll do that, too.

89.speaker: PENGUIN
89.english: Can you even ride a motorcycle?

90.speaker: POLAR BEAR
90.japanese: 免許取れないかもしれないね
90.english: I doubt you'd be able to get your license. If I recall correctly, Mr. Llama's hobby is bonsai.

92.speaker: LLAMA
92.japanese: どうです？ この枝ぶり
92.english: What do you think about these branches?

93.speaker: LLAMA
93.japanese: おっと… 芽摘みしなくては

94.speaker: LLAMA
94.japanese: う～ん ちょっとチクチクしますね

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.japanese: 趣味と実益を兼ねてるね
96.english: He's combining practicality with his hobby. I'll do that, too.

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.japanese: キミは なんにでものっかるね

98.speaker: POLAR BEAR
98.japanese: ナマケモノくんは編み物が趣味だって

99.speaker: POLAR BEAR
99.japanese: マフラー 編み始めて３年目らしいね
99.english: I hear he's been knitting a scarf for three years.

100.speaker: PENGUIN
100.japanese: 生きてる間に使えればいいけど…
100.english: Hopefully he'll be able to use it while he's alive.

101.speaker: PENGUIN
101.japanese: どうして 作り始めちゃったんだろうね
101.english: I wonder why he even started.

103.speaker: PENGUIN
103.japanese: キミもう ただ言うだけになってない？
103.english: I think you just want to say that phrase now.

104.speaker: POLAR BEAR
104.japanese: あと ゾウガメさんの趣味は…
104.english: And Mr. Tortoise's hobby... I thought he liked cameras.

105.speaker: POLAR BEAR
105.japanese: いや 最近はスカッシュだって
105.english: Nope. Apparently he started playing squash.

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.japanese: それってさ… ゾウガメくんっていうより
107.english: You know... That sounds more like the other person's hobby, rather than Tortoise's...

109.speaker: PENGUIN
109.japanese: パンダくん 絵かかない？
109.english: Do you want to draw, Panda?

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: 僕 教えてもいいよ？

112.speaker: POLAR BEAR
112.japanese: 嫌だって ペンギンさん

113.speaker: PENGUIN
113.japanese: キミたち もう帰ったら？
113.english: Why don't you two go home? What are your hobbies, Mr. Penguin?

114.speaker: PENGUIN
114.japanese: ここで それ聞くかな？
114.english: Are you really asking me that here?

115.speaker: PENKO1
115.english: I wonder if this is the place.

117.speaker: PENGUIN
117.japanese: ペン子さんたちなら きっと芸術をわかってくれるよ！
117.english: Look! I'm sure Miss Penko and the others understand art.

131.speaker: PENKO1
131.japanese: ご飯食べに行きましょう

133.speaker: PANDA
133.japanese: みんな ひどいなぁ

135.speaker: PENGUIN
135.japanese: フォローありがとう パンダくん

136.speaker: PENGUIN
136.japanese: でもね それは絵だよ

137.speaker: POLAR BEAR
137.english: Mr. Penguin, I brought a gift.

140.speaker: POLAR BEAR
140.japanese: きっと ペン子さんたちも いつか わかってくれるよ
140.english: I'm sure Miss Penko and the others will understand someday... Polar Bear... In about fifty years.

141.speaker: PENGUIN
141.english: I wonder if I'll be alive.

149.speaker: GRIZZLY
149.japanese: 悪かったな おどかすつもりはなかったんだ
149.english: Sorry about that. Didn't mean to scare ya.

150.speaker: LLAMA
150.japanese: いえいえ こちらこそ取り乱してしまって すみません
150.english: Not at all. I apologize for losing my composure. The entrance's light went out,

151.speaker: POLAR BEAR
151.japanese: グリズリーくんに来てもらったんだよ
151.english: so I asked Grizzly to come over.

152.speaker: GRIZZLY
152.japanese: 急ぎの用があるっていうから 来たのに
152.english: I came because you said you had an urgent matter.

153.speaker: GRIZZLY
153.japanese: なんで 電球の取り替えなんだよ
153.english: Why the hell am I here just to change a light bulb?

155.speaker: POLAR BEAR
155.japanese: わざわざ 手間をかけさせちゃったね
155.english: Sorry for troubling you. As long as you acknowledge that.

156.speaker: POLAR BEAR
156.japanese: あっ そういえばテラスの雨どいの調子も 悪かったんだよね
156.english: Oh, now that I think of it, the rain gutter by the terrace needs work.

157.speaker: POLAR BEAR
157.japanese: ついでに 直してよ

158.speaker: GRIZZLY
158.japanese: てめえ…！ 俺を なんだと思ってやがる！
158.english: Why you... Just who do you think I am?!

160.speaker: PANDA
160.japanese: グリズリーさんって いい人だよね
160.english: Mr. Grizzly is such a nice guy.

162.speaker: PANDA
162.japanese: でも かっこいいよね

164.speaker: GRIZZLY
164.japanese: 怖くて 悪かったな

165.speaker: GRIZZLY
165.english: I fixed it. The next time it rains, let me know how it holds up.

167.speaker: GRIZZLY
167.japanese: いいかげんにしろ この野郎！
167.english: Damn it, would you stop it?!

170.speaker: PANDA
170.japanese: ねえねえ シロクマくんと グリズリーさんっていつから友達だったの？
170.english: Hey, how long have you two been friends? I wonder how long it's been...

173.speaker: GRIZZLY
173.japanese: 俺様は アラスカの王者だ～！
173.english: I'm the king of Alaska! How was that?

176.speaker: GRIZZLY
176.english: Polar Bear? Fear me! Run away!

177.speaker: GRIZZLY
177.japanese: 俺はグリズリーだ！ 偉いんだ～！ 王者なんだぞ！
177.english: I'm Grizzly! I'm special! I'm a king!

184.speaker: GRIZZLY
184.japanese: ぜんぜん怖がってねえだろ お前！
184.english: You're not scared at all, are you?!

186.speaker: GRIZZLY
186.japanese: グリズリーが大きくなったら

187.japanese: ほんとに アラスカの王者なんだからな
187.english: truly become the kings of Alaska!

188.speaker: POLAR BEAR
188.japanese: シロクマは 大きくなったら

189.speaker: POLAR BEAR
189.japanese: 地上最大の肉食獣だよ
189.english: They become the world's largest land carnivore.

190.speaker: GRIZZLY
190.japanese: クソ～！ 王者ごっこはやめだ！ やめ！
190.english: Damn it! I'm done with the king game! Done!

191.speaker: POLAR BEAR
191.english: Grizzly! Who do you think you are?

193.speaker: GRIZZLY
193.japanese: それは 昨日聞いた！

195.speaker: POLAR BEAR
195.english: Do you wanna play? What? Why would I play with yo—

196.speaker: GRIZZLY
196.japanese: 王者ごっこはもうやらねえぞ！
196.english: I'm not playing the king game anymore!

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.japanese: じゃあ 別のことをして遊ぼう

199.speaker: GRIZZLY
199.japanese: どうだ～！ かけっこは 俺の勝ちだ～！
199.english: How was that?! I won the race!

200.speaker: POLAR BEAR
200.japanese: 僕のほうが荷物が重いからね
200.english: Well, my stuff is heavier. Is that bag that heavy?

201.speaker: POLAR BEAR
201.japanese: うん ほら 持ってみて
201.english: Yup. Here, hold it. Why do I have to hold it?

204.speaker: GRIZZLY
204.english: Hey! Wait! Where the heck did he go? Grizzly.

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.japanese: 僕のお兄ちゃん 似てるでしょ？
207.english: This is my older brother. Don't we look alike?

209.speaker: GRIZZLY
209.japanese: あっ どうも はじめましてお兄さん
209.english: Oh, nice to meet you, sir.

210.speaker: GRIZZLY
210.english: My name is Grizzly. He's just a dog!

211.speaker: GRIZZLY
211.japanese: お前 変わってんな

212.speaker: POLAR BEAR
212.english: Really? Everyone else that sees me gets scared and runs away.

213.speaker: GRIZZLY
213.japanese: お前はぜんぜん違うもんな

214.speaker: POLAR BEAR
214.english: Scary? Jeez. Talking to you puts me off balance.

216.speaker: GRIZZLY
216.english: I don't know! Delicious! There are so many delicious things to eat in the fall!

217.speaker: GRIZZLY
217.japanese: 食欲の秋っていうもんな
217.english: Well, they do call autumn the "season of good appetite."

218.speaker: POLAR BEAR
218.japanese: グリズリーくんって いつも何食べてるの？
218.english: What do you usually eat, Grizzly?

219.speaker: GRIZZLY
219.japanese: まぁ 魚とかも食うけど
219.english: Well, I eat fish, too. But the best thing to eat in autumn is berries. I see.

220.speaker: GRIZZLY
220.japanese: シロクマって 何食ってんだよ？
220.english: What do you eat, Polar Bear?

223.speaker: POLAR BEAR
223.japanese: クジラとかも食べたりするよ

224.speaker: GRIZZLY
224.japanese: お… 大物だな いつも そんなのとってんのか
224.english: Th-That's huge... Do you always catch things that big?

226.speaker: POLAR BEAR
226.english: Most of the time, I don't catch anything.

227.speaker: GRIZZLY
227.japanese: とれないときは どうしてるんだ？
227.english: What do you do on days that you can't catch anything?

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.japanese: ひたすら ダラダラしてるよ

229.speaker: GRIZZLY
229.japanese: なんか すごいんだか なんだか よくわかんないな
229.english: I don't know if I should be impressed or what...

230.speaker: POLAR BEAR
230.english: Well, all I can do is wait.

232.speaker: GRIZZLY
232.japanese: お 俺は食えねえぞ！

235.speaker: GRIZZLY
235.japanese: っても 誰もいないけどな
235.english: No one else is home, though.

236.speaker: GRIZZLY
236.japanese: 今日は 母さん遅くまで 帰ってこないんだ
236.english: My mom won't be home until later.

238.speaker: POLAR BEAR
238.japanese: じゃあ ご飯何か作るよ
238.english: Then I'll make us something to eat.

239.speaker: GRIZZLY
239.english: What can you make? Well... There's bear paw stew.

240.speaker: POLAR BEAR
240.english: Just kidding. Your jokes are scary!

242.speaker: GRIZZLY
242.japanese: おれ サケのシチューが 大好物なんだよな

246.speaker: GRIZZLY
246.english: I said stew! You're so short-tempered.

251.speaker: MOM
251.japanese: ごめんね 遅くなっちゃって
251.english: Sorry I got back so late.

252.speaker: MOM
252.japanese: あら？ 仲のいいこと

254.speaker: SASAKO
254.japanese: グリズリーさんとシロクマさんって
254.english: So you two have been friends since you were little.

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.english: So you're what they call "childhood friends."

256.speaker: GRIZZLY
256.japanese: まあ 子供の頃からずっとだしな
256.english: Well, we have been together since we were kids.

257.speaker: GRIZZLY
257.japanese: いわゆる 腐れ縁ってやつだな
257.english: You can say we're sort of stuck with each other. I'm hungry.

258.speaker: LLAMA
258.japanese: もう 夕方ですしね

259.speaker: GRIZZLY
259.japanese: ああ 話し込んじまったな
259.english: Guess that story ran a little long.

260.speaker: GRIZZLY
260.japanese: 俺 そろそろ帰るわ

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.japanese: ああ ちょっと待って

264.speaker: SASAKO
264.japanese: サケのシチューですか

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.japanese: まあ 食べてってよ

271.speaker: GRIZZLY
271.japanese: お前 料理だけは上手いよな
271.english: You're good at cooking, if nothing else. I'm good at cooking, as well, you mean.

272.speaker: PANDA
272.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

273.speaker: PENGUIN
273.english: What is it, Panda? Next week's Polar Bear's Café...

277.speaker: PANDA
277.japanese: ペンギンさん もし生まれ変わるのなら誰の家来になりたい
277.english: Mr. Penguin, if you were reincarnated, whose subordinate would you be?

278.speaker: PENGUIN
278.english: I don't think I'd like to be a subordinate.

279.speaker: PANDA
279.japanese: じゃ生まれ変わったら どんな苦労がしたい
279.english: If you were reincarnated, what hardships would you face?

282.speaker: PENGUIN
282.english: This is your part, Polar Bear!

285.speaker: POLAR BEAR
285.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは 爆発だ！
285.english: Next week's Polar Bear's Café... will explode! It will not.
